original_title: GMOA wants details of emergency purchase of medicines
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Government Medical Officers' Association said it will direct a letter to the Secretary of the Ministry of Health requesting information regarding the emergency purchase of medicines under the Right to Information Act.
GMOA Spokesman Dr. Chamil Wijesinghe said they expect to find out how many emergency purchases were made and how much money was spent on them.

The GMOA said the Ministry of Health continues to make emergency purchases, despite the various health concerns due to quality issues, and has failed to formulate a plan to make purchases through the usual procurement process.

Dr. Wijesinghe said issues have arisen regarding the quality of medicine brought down through emergency purchases, through suppliers who are not approved by the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA).
He said the Ministry of Health has failed to reveal information regarding the matter officially and therefore two letters will be directed to the Health Secretary under the RTI Act.

He said one letter will be regarding the details of the emergency purchases during the past year, while the other will be regarding the amount of medicine and medical equipment which were removed from use due to quality issues.
